summary: Eve: I think about you all the time. Villanelle: I wank over you a lot. Me: SNOG SNOG SNOG YOU ARE LITERALLY THERE TELLING EACH...
body:
Eve: I think about you all the time.

Villanelle: I wank over you a lot.

Me: SNOG SNOG SNOG YOU ARE LITERALLY THERE TELLING EACH OTHER YOU WANT TO PLEASE JUST FUCKING SNOG AND THEN HAVE THE HOTTEST SEX.

Straight friend after watching the finale: I thought they were going to hug at the end.

summary: So. I did a KE re-run last night
title: So. I did a KE re-run last night
body:
… and oh boy, did I find myself gaping about stuff I hadn’t really thought about before. And this is from someone who freaking breathes Killing Eve. 

1) Episode 3, Villanelle’s HAIR. Let me explain. Bill comes over, cut, we see Villanelle listening to the audio thing on her computer. Like, right after it happened/or live. In the next scene, Eve’s dressed up and she heads out with Bill. Okay, so, I’m guessing maybe 30 minutes passed. She was shaving at the sink, so she didn’t shower, so it can’t have been more then 30 minutes. Out they go, and Villanelle is right there, two steps behind them, at the U-Bahn. Okay, so, my point: DID YOU GUYS SEE THE FREAKING HAIR. I know her suit stole all the attention, but that braid thing would seriously have taken AGES. And yet here she is, just in step with them, looking amazing. I KNOW. It’s fictional, whatever, but I find myself annoyed at this to no end, especially when I try to braid my own thick-ass lion mane and my arms start cramping after like 10 minutes… 

2) Episode 3, Funkeln. As someone who knows the Berlin party scene, Bill is tracking Villanelle to the club at around 9.30. THE PLACE IS PACKED. I mean, PACKED, PACKED. So packed, she manages to kill him in there. It’s one of my favourite scenes and the whole thing is so well made and so chilling but BERLINERS COME ON YOU KNOW NO BAR IS PACKED AT 9.30, WEEKEND OR NOT. YOU KNOW THIS. I just realized the timeline, and now I’m just so bummed. 

That’s it for now. I’ll probably remember something else at like 3 in the morning, then forget it before I wake up again.

tags: imagine what their relationship looked like!
summary: Honestly, I like the scene where Villanelle hits Nadia on the nose, covers the punch with a serious “I don’t want you to get...
body:
Honestly, I like the scene where Villanelle hits Nadia on the nose, covers the punch with a serious “I don’t want you to get hurt, okay?” feigns sentimentality and then manages to lie to Diego with a sarcastic “she had a wasp on her nose” because it’s so clear every move towards Nadia is calculated.

Nadia’s the one who pretty much throws herself at Villanelle because of her feelings - rage and resentment ever-present - but Villanelle really just works on simple, controlled calculations so she can easily make use of Nadia’s vulnerability with consistent manipulation. That adds to her unpredictability too because even though she hurts Nadia quite literally her words still come off as believable to the girl. Which really worked for the scene as it takes Villanelle no effort at all; her action is very sharp and clean and Nadia walks off saying “it’s fine”. So I guess the “whoops” actually rings true at the end since Nadia still falls for her words and almost dies. This show and its……………… TWISTS.

summary: There is a part in the book where it describes how villanelle feels when she kills but I can’t remember it. Do you know ?
question: There is a part in the book where it describes how villanelle feels when she kills but I can’t remember it. Do you know ?
answer:
Hello! Yes, I can think of two instances where her feelings are described. Both are from “Codename Villanelle”. Here:

”For several long seconds, Villanelle is overwhelmed by the intensity of the killings, and by satisfaction so piercing that it’s close to pain. It’s the feeling that sex always promises but never quite delivers, and for a moment she clutches herself, gasping, through the Valentino dress.“ (After killing Salvatore Greco at the opera)

”Rising on her toes like a matador, eyes demonic, Villanelle sidesteps the black swathe of blood thrown from the falling body. Simon’s limbs shudder, a bubbling sound issues from his neck, and as he dies Villanelle feels a rush of feeling so intense, so icily numbing, it almost brings her to her knees.” (Killing Eve’s partner Simon in Shanghai)

body:
Seasonal Shift, a playlist by Supriya Chaudhary on Spotify

The Killing Eve adoration aint quitting any time soon. Meanwhile, here’s a playlist tenuously linked to the changing seasons and Killing Eve via some pumpkins on the cover art. Living for well-written female characters, guys, what can I say…

summary: ALL CAPS, all the time: why are so many shows bombarding us with giant fonts?
title: ALL CAPS, all the time: why are so many shows bombarding us with giant fonts?
excerpt: From Killing Eve to Mindhunter and Narcos, there’s a trend in TV for colossal captions. It’s a confident style choice that nods to noir fiction. Jack Seale October 26, 2018 The Guardian David Finch…

summary: My dad is watching Killing Eve (finally, I’ve been telling him to for ages) and he’s enjoying it.  He is, however, disturbed...
body:
My dad is watching Killing Eve (finally, I’ve been telling him to for ages) and he’s enjoying it. 

He is, however, disturbed that Villanelle is such a likable character. Clearly, he has not watched enough shows where the antagonist is more likable than the protagonist.
